data.text: Lord, my enemies have become so many; so many are rebelling3:1. Since David is the writer this is clearly a reference to a widespread rebellion against him as king. against me.
So many are telling me, “God can't save you!” Selah.
But you, Lord, are a shield protecting me. You give me victory;3:3. Literally, “you are my glory” which makes little sense in English. you hold my head high.
I cry out to the Lord for help, and he answers me from his holy mountain. Selah.
I lie down to sleep, and in the morning3:5. Implied. I wake up because the Lord takes care of me.
I'm not afraid of tens of thousands who surround me, people who are against me.
Stand up for me, Lord! Save me, my God! Hit all my enemies on the cheek; break the teeth of the wicked!
Salvation belongs to you, Lord; may you be a blessing to your people. Selah.
